glsa.title: Lsyncd: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Lsyncd allows execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: A daemon to synchronize local directories using rsync.

description.p: default-rsyncssh.lua in Lsyncd performed insufficient sanitising of filenames.

impact.p: An attacker, able to control files processed by Lsyncd, could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Lsyncd users should upgrade to the latest version:
